properties.Name: Soweto SAF
properties.notes: Transformation focuses on shifting it from a predominantly residential area to a fully functional urban district. The plan aims to diversify land use by introducing job-generating businesses, services, and mixed-use nodes around transit hubs.

properties.Name: Strijdom Park Industrial Area
properties.notes: The city is consolidating growth around Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) Corridors. These corridors align with major transit infrastructure (Rea Vaya, Gautrain, PRASA) and serve as key spines for mixed-use, high-density development.

properties.Name: Randburg Node

properties.Name: Inner City
properties.notes: The city’s dense economic core. The goal is to address challenges like urban decay, crime, and housing shortages by creating compact, inclusive precincts structured around transit and economic activity. Investment will be directed toward public space, infrastructure, and social facilities to support residential densification and economic renewal.

properties.Name: Mining Belt
properties.notes: Once a barrier dividing the city, is now seen as a major opportunity for integration. Strategic redevelopment along this stretch includes road linkages, mixed-use infill, and land rehabilitation, transforming degraded land into inclusive, connected urban space.
